The structural analysis and phase crystallinity of the synthesized Cu-Nps were examined via the powder X-ray diffraction method. Figure 7 signifies a Cu nanoparticle diffraction pattern at a 2 θ value of 43.20°, 50.42°, and 74.15° respect to (111), (200), and (220) planes individually; it conformed the formation of copper cubic lattice. JCPDS No. 040836 indicates the good agreement and comparison with the standard pattern for pure face centered cubic phase of copper nanoparticles. There are no impurity peaks observed. The strong peaks indicate the highly crystalline nature of the formed nanoparticles. From the observed main diffracted peak, the average crystalline size can be calculated using the Scherer equation.
